ru.yandex.yandexmapkit.overlay
Class OverlayItem

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--ru.yandex.yandexmapkit.overlay.OverlayItem
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Comparable
Direct Known Subclasses:
BalloonItem, DragAndDropItem, MyLocationItem
public class OverlayItem
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable

OverlayItem.java: Renders an overlay object. By default an overlay object is rendered at the center of its bitmap, and the balloon (if present) is rendered above it.

This file is a part of the Yandex Map Kit.

Version for Android Â© 2012 YANDEX

isVisible

public boolean isVisible()
Checks the visibility of the object being rendered.
Returns:
the object is visible while it is being rendered, false - hidden

getScreenPoint

public ScreenPoint getScreenPoint()
Returns the point with screen coordinates corresponding to a position on the screen where the element has been rendered.
Returns:
the point with screen coordinates corresponding to a position on the screen where the element has been rendered

setScreenPoint

public void setScreenPoint(ScreenPoint screenPoint)
Sets the point (YScreenPoint) where the element should be rendered. The method is called every time when the object is being rendered.

getOffsetY

public int getOffsetY()
Returns the auxiliary offset along the Y axis relative to the center of the image. This offset shows how the starting point of the image rendering is shifted against the center.
Returns:
int the offset along the Y axis relative to the center of the image

setOffsetY

public void setOffsetY(int offsetY)
Sets the auxiliary offset along the Y axis relative to the center of the image. This offset shifts the starting point of the image rendering.
Parameters:
offsetY - the auxiliary offset along the Y axis relative to the center of the image
